about_the_game:
Outline

You, a mechanic, have picked up three robots from a scrapyard.

"J.S.C.A" : a robot waitress at the diner.

"Surverry" : a security robot for monitoring offices.

"Devind R7" : a combat robot that seems to have been developed for military use.

In a dimly lit garage, you charge and revive the robots.

After that, you can peek into their memories through dialogue.

Or you can enjoy the robots' reactions by applying high voltage to them.

However, their batteries only have a short lifespan left.

How they spend the rest of their lives is in your hands...

GAME DESIGN

This is an adventure game.

You can select one of three robots and charge and converse with them within a time limit.

How you treat them will change their reactions,

and the ending of the game will change little by little along with their fate.

You, the owner of the electrical outlet and the high-voltage switch,

have the power to make your robots happy or unhappy.

You can play with the same robot over and over again.

You can aim to unlock all ending achievements, or you can just try to make the robots happy.

FEATURES

- Nostalgic 4-color pixel art reminiscent of 90's portable game consoles

- Enjoy various conversations with attractive robot characters

- Each play time is about 15 minutes, so you can play easily

short_description: BatteryNote is a multi-ending sci-fi adventure visual novel game. You can recharge three robots with limited lifespans, bringing them back to life. Interact with them through conversations or experiment by applying high voltage. How they spend their final moments is entirely up to you.
supported_languages: Japanese, English, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese
